definition: to call/to cry/to shout/to breath out/to exhale
variant of 呼[hu1]/to shout/to call out
to die (idiom)/to breathe one's last/to give up the ghost

sentences.english: This bird employs its beak as a weapon.
sentences.chinese: 用鸟喙啄了几下就让这条蛇一命呜呼了。

sentences.english: If it had hit them, they could have all been killed.
sentences.chinese: 如果当时真打中他们，他们可能全都一命呜呼。

sentences.english: A bullet through the heart ended her.
sentences.chinese: 一粒子弹穿心过肺，使她一命呜呼。

sentences.english: He died of a broken neck.
It was enough to give a cheer last month when he rasped his last sour breath.
sentences.chinese: 就那次足以让我为他上个月的一命呜呼欢呼了。

sentences.english: A bumble-bee stung one then there were five.
sentences.chinese: 飞来一蜇命呜呼，六个只剩五。

sentences.english: Several years later, Zhang Kan alas a disease, leaving a hard to make ends meet youngest.
sentences.chinese: 过了几年，张堪一病呜呼，丢下一家老小艰辛度日。

sentences.english: Some evening night returns, rance encounters a serious traffic accident, result die.
sentences.chinese: 某晚夜归，兰斯遭遇一场严重车祸，结果一命呜呼。

sentences.english: Now i am even more tense .
sentences.chinese: 呜呼，现在比下单前更紧张了。

definition: classical final particle, similar to modern 了[le5]
I beg you to partake of this sacrifice (used at the end of an elegiac address)
to slap one's own buttocks in excitement or despair
to die/to lose/to be gone/to flee/deceased
(particle in old Chinese similar to 啊)
equally true for (all the rest)/the same thing applies (for everyone)
